data.title: The woman who wants to bring the glory days back at Sky
data.meta_description: A boardroom exodus, uncertainty over Sky News and its key HBO deal… Dana Strong, who replaced Jeremy Darroch as chief executive, has to tackle a bulging in-tray
data.text:
When Stephen van Rooyen, Sky’s recently departed UK and Europe head, flew for work, he and his top team would travel in an Embraer Phenom 300, an aircraft with a 17ft-long interior that comfortably seats six passengers.

His boss Dana Strong, so the story goes, would opt for the more upmarket Dassault Falcon 2000, a craft with a kitchen area and a 26ft-long interior big enough for eight passengers.

This apparent disparity between chief executive and underling did not go unnoticed. “Dana gets the big private plane, Stephen gets the small private plane,” said one of their former colleagues. “She cares a lot about external signs of power.”
